Variable MRMs have 4 fire modes and let the user dial between them as desired.
Variable MRM's base mode is the same as a standard MRM: a balance between accuracy, heat, and damage. The base mode has the same accuracy penalty as normal MRMs.
Variable MRM's damage mode increases the damage per missile at the cost of generating much more heat and being even less accurate.
Variable MRM's accuracy mode increases the weapon's accuracy significantly but reduces the damage per missile and increases the heat generated.
Variable MRM's heat mode decreases the heat generated by firing the system but also decreases the accuracy and damage dealt.

Avionics equipment allows the carrying unit to transform between BattleMech and AirMech mode. In AirMech mode the unit gains heavily increased movement speed but is more susceptible to both regular damage and stability damage and is not affected by terrain in any way.
